intro: Helleborus nivalis, commonly known as the snowdrop, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, nodding flowers that bloom in early spring, even through snow, giving it its common name. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are evergreen and persist through the winter. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, with three petals and three sepals. Helleborus nivalis thrives in woodland and shaded areas, preferring moist, well-drained soil.
